name: Side Plank
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your side with your feet stacked and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.

2. Support yourself by placing your forearm on the ground with your elbow directly under your shoulder.
3. Keep your shoulder positioned as close to your ear as possible, avoiding any tucking or shifting.
4. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine, maintaining a firm and straight line from head to heels throughout the movement.

5. Lift your top foot up, keeping it flexed, supporting some of the weight with your toes for added stability.
6. Maintain this position, actively engaging abs and obliques as you stabilize yourself on one side of your body.
short_summary: The Side Plank is an exercise that engages core muscles specifically targeting the sides of your abs and shoulders. This side-lying core engagement helps strengthen lower back support while maintaining posture.
